Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"approveStaker(bytes)":{"params":{"signature":"The signature of the message"}},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-balanceOf}."},"balanceOfAt(address,uint256)":{"details":"Retrieves the balance of `account` at the time `snapshotId` was created."},"canAccrue()":{"returns":{"_0":"Boolean indicating if rewards can be accrued"}},"claimPartial(uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"endSnapshotId":"The snapshot id to end the partial claim","startSnapshotId":"The snapshot id to start the partial claim"}},"constructor":{"params":{"distributor":"Address of the distributor","eip712Name":"Name of the EIP712 signing domain","eip712Version":"Current major version of the EIP712 signing domain","name":"Name of the staked token","rewardToken":"Instance of the reward token","snapshotDelay":"The minimum amount of time between snapshots","stakeMessage":"The message to sign when staking","stakeToken":"Instance of the stake token","symbol":"Symbol of the staked token"}},"decimals()":{"details":"Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the default value returned by this function, unless it's overridden. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}."},"decreaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`."},"eip712Domain()":{"details":"See {EIP-5267}. _Available since v4.9._"},"getCurrentSnapshotId()":{"returns":{"_0":"The current snapshot id"}},"getLifetimeRewards(address)":{"params":{"account":"The account to retrieve rewards for"},"returns":{"_0":"The rewards across all snapshots for `account`"}},"getPendingRewards(address)":{"params":{"account":"The account to retrieve pending rewards for"},"returns":{"_0":"The rewards pending to be claimed by `account`"}},"getStakeSignatureDigest()":{"returns":{"_0":"The hashed bytes to be signed"}},"getTimeUntilNextSnapshot()":{"returns":{"_0":"The time until the next snapshot"}},"increaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"name()":{"details":"Returns the name of the token."},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. params.amount: The amount of rewardToken to accrue

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `amount` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

balanceOfAt(address,uint256).details: Retrieves the balance of `account` at the time `snapshotId` was created.

returns._0: Boolean indicating if rewards can be accrued

params.endSnapshotId: The snapshot id to end the partial claim
params.startSnapshotId: The snapshot id to start the partial claim

params.eip712Name: Name of the EIP712 signing domain
params.eip712Version: Current major version of the EIP712 signing domain
params.name: Name of the staked token
params.snapshotDelay: The minimum amount of time between snapshots
params.stakeMessage: The message to sign when staking

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the default value returned by this function, unless it's overridden. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

params.account: The account to retrieve rewards for

returns._0: The rewards across all snapshots for `account`

params.account: The account to retrieve pending rewards for

returns._0: The rewards pending to be claimed by `account`
The hashed bytes to be signed
The time until the next snapshot

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

returns._0: The total pool reward at the time `snapshotId`

params.account: The account to retrieve rewards for
The account to retrieve rewards for

returns._0: The rewards of `account` in the range of `startSnapshotId` to `endSnapshotId`

params.amount: The amount of stakeToken to stake

stake(uint256,bytes).details: Approves the staker if not already approved

params.amount: The amount of stakeToken to stake

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

totalSupplyAt(uint256).details: Retrieves the total supply at the time `snapshotId` was created.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params.amount: The amount of stakeToken to unstake

accrue(uint256).notice: ONLY DISTRIBUTOR: Accrue rewardToken and update snapshot.

approveStaker(bytes).notice: Approve the signer of the message as an approved staker

canAccrue().notice: Check if rewards can be accrued.

claim().notice: Claim the staking rewards from pending snapshots for `msg.sender`.

claimPartial(uint256,uint256).notice: Claim partial staking rewards from pending snapshots for `msg.sender` from `_startClaimId` to `_endClaimId`.

getLifetimeRewards(address).notice: Retrieves the rewards across all snapshots for `account`.

getPendingRewards(address).notice: Retrieves the rewards pending to be claimed by `account`.

getStakeSignatureDigest().notice: Get the hashed digest of the message to be signed for staking

getTimeUntilNextSnapshot().notice: Get the time until the next snapshot.

nextClaimId(address).notice: Next snapshot id for `account` to claim

rewardAt(uint256).notice: Retrieves the total pool reward at the time `snapshotId`.

rewardOfAt(address,uint256).notice: Retrieves the rewards of `account` at the `snapshotId`.

rewardOfInRange(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Retrives the rewards of `account` in the range of `startSnapshotId` to `endSnapshotId`.

rewardToken().notice: Token to be distributed as rewards

setDistributor(address).notice: ONLY OWNER: Update the distributor address.

setSnapshotDelay(uint256).notice: ONLY OWNER: Update the snapshot delay. Can set to 0 to disable snapshot delay.

stake(uint256).notice: Stake `amount` of stakeToken from `msg.sender` and mint staked tokens.

stake(uint256,bytes).notice: Stake `amount` of stakeToken from `msg.sender` and mint staked tokens.

transfer(address,uint256).notice: Prevents transfers of the staked token.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: Prevents transfers of the staked token.

documentation.text: @notice Error when staker is not approved
@notice Emitted when a staker has message signature approved
